title: Marija Gimbutas
summary: Marija Gimbutas (Lithuanian: Marija Gimbutienė, Lithuanian pronunciation: ​['ɡɪmbutas]; January 23, 1921 – February 2, 1994) was a Lithuanian archaeologist and anthropologist known for her research into the Neolithic and Bronze Age cultures of "Old Europe" and for her Kurgan hypothesis, which located the Proto-Indo-European homeland in the Pontic Steppe.
